story:
The world of digital multi-effects and simulators has managed to offer great sounds in the past decade. But it still imposes a lot of limitations on how guitarists can assemble their setups.
 

Unless you want to spend thousands of dollars or go around with devices that are immense.

 

The new MOD Dwarf offers unprecedented patching freedom, new plugins for download every month, and plenty of power to use as many simultaneous plugins as you want.

 

This is an open platform for effects, amp simulations, cabinets, virtual instruments, synthesizers, and MIDI utilities and everything else you would like to install and bring along with you inside a standalone device. 

 

This is our third-product.

 

MOD created the MOD Duo, the MOD Duo X. Now we are excited to introduce the product we always wanted to make.

 

The MOD Dwarf completely changes the game:

  • It facilitates access to open-source technology
  • It allows bringing plugins to gigs in a stage-ready, very compact box. 
  • It transforms this experience, already present in MOD products, much cheaper than we were able to provide until this point.

 

There are thousands of developers around the world working on great-sounding open-source plugins. It turns out that most musicians never get to know about it.

 

MOD has established a bridge by curating these digital creations and making them available for everyone.

 

This is the first time musicians and developers have a rock-solid dedicated platform to connect them. 

 

The MOD Plugin Shop offers more than 300 hundred plugins ready to download with one click. We are constantly updating the offer so users have access to the best sounds and new effects, virtual instruments and utilities every month.

 

Apart from that, new creations are always brewing in the backroom from the MOD Plugin Shop in a place for the braves and adventurers called MOD Labs. 

 

 

MOD LABS: ENTIRE GALAXIES OF PLUGINS ON YOUR HANDS

 

This is a place for the braves. A place for cultivating sonic experiments. The MOD Labs houses open-source plugin development, Arduino-based hardware creation, and beta tester programs.

 

But you don't need to be a creative coder to explore these lands. Any user can easily opt-in to delve into more 400 plugins hosted inside the MOD Labs and take their sound ambitions to new realms of experimentation.

 

THE PEDALBOARD FEED

 

The Pedalboard feed is a user-friendly solution to share your patches with the MOD community without having to export files. Just click the share buttons, record a quick sound and it's done.

 

You can even upload your patches in incognito mode, and use the URL to keep your patches safe on the cloud or share it only with your friends.

 

Feeling curious about what other users are creating with their MOD products. Just access the feed and download patches that self-assemble inside your MOD Dwarf in seconds.

 

Inside the tough enclosure, the MOD Dwarf houses a Quad-core 64 bit ARM CPU running at 1.3GHz , with 8 gb storage, and 1 gb RAM.

 

This allows you to run several plugins simultaneously, including those that demand more CPU, such as pitch-shifters. Try to find a competitor at this price point that can run nine pitch-shifters at the same time.

 

Of course, you can save hundreds of patches inside the MOD Dwarf. But if you prefer, just throw all your favorite plugins in one board and play around with a truly multi-purpose, without having to worry about anything else.

 

More power also means ultra high-fidelity to model analog circuitry, high-quality amps, convolution cabsims, convolution reverbs and polyphonic synths.

 

We've created a beast that can go with you everywhere. 

 

 This has been a key topic around multi-fx units: how many plugins can you use simultaneously and in which way can you patch them? We don't want to join the discussion, so we simply allow you to decide for yourself. Without imposed restrictions.

 

CREATE PATCHES ON THE FLY

 

Assemble patches from the device with only a couple of clicks and spins. Three system-dedicated push-buttons and the shift button allow for easy navigation and editing.

 

Or open the graphical interface from any tablet, smartphone or computer to create

complex rigs. 

 

THE GRAPHICAL INTERFACE

 

With an intuitive drag & drop system, nailing your sound was never so easy and fun. 

 

MOD's matchless graphic interface opens allows for as many parallel paths as you want. Duplicate, join or feedback signals. Everything is possible.

 

Color-coded cables help you keep track of your audio, midi and internal-CV signals even on the most complex scenarios.

 

Everything can be assigned to controllers on the device. 

 

Enjoy the truly modular DNA only the MOD Dwarf has to offer.

 

MADE IN GERMANY

 

As prices drop, a lot of the music gear out there has become more fragile. Some of the best-sellers multi-fx have quirked lines, slightly bent knobs, and sloppy overall finishing.

 

The MOD Dwarf will be made in Germany, carefully produced at the highest standards, and resistant enough to withstand thousands and thousands of gigs.

 

THE ENCLOSURE

 

Monolithic die-cast aluminum enclosure with laser engraving. The body is one single piece of metal, without openings or folded metal sheets. We don't play with plastic.

 

This strong shell is powder-coated in black, offering the highest resistance against scratches, dents and absolutely no chance for paint flaking.

 

THE KNOBS

 

We think of knobs as science. Really.

 

Knobs are too important to use shelf alternatives. That's why every MOD device has knobs designed from scratch.

 

The knurled surface will remain present to allow better grip, as the encoders will present an optimum degree of resistance for enhanced precision.

 

Needless to say, you can address any parameter you want to your knobs.

 

This is a MOD device, after all.

 

THE FOOTSWITCHES

 

The MOD Dwarf footswitches are soft-touch, momentary, non-latching pieces.

 

While common latching footswitches are necessarily toggled, on this type of footswitch all the activation is decided via software. This makes it extremely flexible for different functions such as toggle, list navigation, trigger, bypass, push and hold or tap.

 

We've been using the same footswitches model for the last 5 years

 

These are from CSI, the same brand used by MXR and other brands recognized by having long-lasting products.

 

LONG-LASTING DESIGN

 

Enclosures, knobs, and footswitches are made of aluminum rather than plastic. The components in all MOD Devices are designed to be resistant to time and rough use.

 

The MOD plugin shop offers more than 300 free plugins ready for download.

 

You don't need to scroll through file lists in download sections from websites, neither install drivers or firmware updates.

 

Everything happens inside the browser-based interface. Just click on the Plugin Shop and get your plugins with one single click.

 
Play with the classics or experiment with innovative new creations from developers all around the world. We are constantly polishing new plugins and making them available every month.

 

Load your own Impulse Responses: Apart from the large collections of high-quality impulse responses built in the MOD cabinets, the Dwarf allows you to load your own IR via a newly developed file-handling system.

 

Just plug the Dwarf yo your computer or use a USB stick to transfer your IR files and use an IR Cabinet shell to bring your favorite tones everywhere.

 

WHY OPEN-SOURCE PLUGINS

 

The way we see it, manufacturers should not be the only detainers of the power to choose what users can or cannot have access to.

 

There's an open-world out there, populated by plugins of great quality created by talented developers. We want to open the gates to this world, so everyone can enter and make use of it.

 

That's why MOD products run LV2 plugins, a modern, open and extensible plugin standard designed for real-time operation.

 

CREATE YOUR OWN EFFECTS WITH MAX/MSP

 

Oh yes, you can do that too! We offer an integration developed together with Cycling 74, which allows anyone to create plugins with the Max environment. Export your own plugins in gen~ and use it on your gigs inside the MOD Dwarf. Oh, and we offer an SDK builder that you can use to create a graphical interface in a couple of minutes.

 

The high-quality AD-DA circuitry provides an audio-interface quality level rarely found in mass-market digital sound processors.

 

AUDIO-INTERFACE

 

Yes, the MOD Dwarf works as an audio interface.

 

But it also does much more than that.

 

The audio-over-USB function allows you to route your signal with or without processing it by your patches, as well as to manage physical and virtual I/O.

 

And that's not only for audio. The MOD Dwarf also allows bidirectional MIDI via USB, which you can address to a specific or to the MIDI aggregator.

 

As a class-compliant audio and MIDI devices, the MOD Dwarf is compatible with leading DAWs and plugins: 

 

TEACHERS LOVE MOD DEVICES

 

“The MOD has almost entirely ended the need for dragging around a large pedalboard. With endless customization possibilities, Midi functionality, looping capability, it has become the go-to processor for all areas of my playing, practicing and teaching”.

- Dan Bowden, Professor of the Guitar Department at Berklee College of Music

 

"Incredibly exciting! There's a game element to MOD. It's freedom in a box!" 

- Katarina Tigerlight, Effects Instructor at BIMM

 

We are based in Berlin and have talented individuals working from the Netherlands, France, the USA, and Brazil.

 

We created the MOD Duo and the MOD Duo X. These products are used by thousands of musicians and have been praised by several publications and Youtube creators.

 

But we had a consistent piece of feedback: not everyone could afford those products, and to really offer freedom to everyone, we needed to create something more affordable.

 

That's why we decided to kick off the development of the product we always wanted to create. That's the MOD Dwarf. A compact and powerful solution that is much more affordable than any other unit in the market with similar capabilities.

 

It is possible to offer cutting-edge technology at decent prices.

 

If you believe in that premise as much as we do, please help us to make it happen.

 

WE HAVE PARTNERED UP WITH

OUR PRODUCTS

MOD Duo 

 

Our first products produced on a large scale, The Duo inaugurated the MOD platform and drove the evolution of our open-software mindset.

 

MOD Duo X 

 

Created after we recognized the necessity of a tabletop solution with more controls, for several of our users who loved the MOD Duo to produce and perform electronic music.  

 

MOD Footswitch

 

The MOD Footswitch seamlessly connects to your MOD devices to extend the actuators you can use to control your effects.

 

Tech Specs

 

Includes: MOD Dwarf, MOD Dwarf travel case, USB Cable, Quickstart Guide, MOD USB stick, 12V power supply (100V ~ 240V @ 50 ~ 60 Hz).

 

The MOD Dwarf is almost alive! Please support MOD Devices' team of engineers, audio developers, designers and musicians, and join us in the most exciting project of MOD's history. There are fantastic deals for early birds!

 

Follow us on Instagram

Follow us on Facebook

Join our mailing list

We will include these four premium plugins from OverTone DSP as a default for all MOD Dwarf units in Indiegogo.

 

OverTone DSP is a division of Applied Music Technology - https://www.acmt.co.uk/ - and has been offering professional audio plugins for 25 years.

The plugins:

  • DT-1 Distortion
  • PH-1 Phaser 
  • CR-1 Chorus
  • WAH-1 Auto Wah 

 

The First Prototype

 

The MOD Dwarf projects already count with a functioning prototype. We've registered the very first interactions of our engineers testing it. Check it out. 

 

 

 

RISK AND CHALLENGES

 We will include these four premium plugins from OverTone DSP as a default for all MOD Dwarf units in Indiegogo. OverTone DSP is a division of Applied Music Technology - https://www.acmt.co.uk/ - and has been offering professional audio plugins for 25 years.The plugins:
DT-1 Distortion
PH-1 Phaser 
CR-1 Chorus
WAH-1 Auto Wah 
 
  The First Prototype The MOD Dwarf projects already count with a functioning prototype. We've registered the very first interactions of our engineers testing it. Check it out. 
 


 

 
RISK AND CHALLENGES



 
As this is our second crowdfunding endeavor, many "rookie mistakes" that could compromise the fulfillment of the campaign have already been addressed. Before launching the crowdfunding phase of the MOD Dwarf, the company has successfully conducted a crowd investment campaign at Seedmatch - https://www.seedmatch.de/investmentchancen/modd... - in order to guarantee to have the necessary funds for the process. In terms of manufacturing, this is our third product and, since the 2014 MOD Duo campaign, we have been building solid relationships with reliable manufacturing partners. Nevertheless, out-of-our-control situations like the one recently caused by the Coronavirus can cause delays that are to be avoided but always possible. Our delivery date of December 2020 is still achievable, even with the Coronavirus pandemic impacts. If there is a recrudescence of the situation we will inform all campaign backers accordingly. Last but not least, the software development is on a safe track. With the development of our second product - the MOD Duo X - we have migrated our entire OS to the newest 64bit architecture and we are confident to be able to deliver the software in the proposed time frame.

story:
Thanks to funding from outside sources in combination with the current Indiegogo standing, this project has been fully funded! Be sure to pledge for any crowdfund-limited items before it ends, and thank you so much for your support!

This campaign accepts external contributions for contributors who cannot process payments through Indiegogo. Please see the Updates tab for more information on contributing through these means. According to the terms of service, these funds cannot be contributed into the Indiegogo campaign pool of funding, so this page will be frequently updated to show current growth.

 

Similar to how text-to-speech is used to have your computer “read words aloud,” vocal synthesizers let you write music and have your computer “sing” it. This can be a way to draft songs before hiring a real person to sing them, but vocal synthesizers are more often used to feature on songs, giving the songwriter more creative freedom and flexibility not available in a real voice. Synthesizer V Studio is a vocal synthesizer that excels in realism and expressiveness, especially with its AI capabilities, and offers unmatched opportunities for user control with a focus on ease of use that makes it unique among competitors. Synthesizer V allows users to purchase vocals of their choosing in a variety of languages, tones, and vocal ranges, including both standard style and AI powered voices. Synthesizer V’s AI vocals are unique in how quickly they process changes, and how realistic their results can be while still maintaining a high level of user control and input.

SOLARIS is an AI voice library that we at Eclipsed Sounds, LLC are creating for the vocal synthesis program Synthesizer V Studio by Dreamtonics Co., Ltd. SOLARIS will be an English vocal recorded by pop artist Emma Rowley. The SOLARIS vocal product is represented by the character “SOLARIS,” whose mature and powerful design is inspired by the theme of a sun goddess. SOLARIS is meant to represent the limitless possibility of a singer “at your fingertips.”

 

What can I do with SOLARIS?

With SOLARIS, you can:

  • Create original, expressive English singing vocals without hiring a singer

  • Have access to a vocalist for any lyrics and melody you can imagine

  • Make detailed drafts for a human vocalist so you don't need multiple takes to get it right

  • Change any aspect of your created vocals, from breathiness to intensity

Currently, there is only one other native English language vocal available for Synthesizer V. With the SOLARIS project, we intend to expand the options available on this engine for the vast community of English language vocal synthesis users and extend the reach of Synthesizer V outside of the existing vocal synthesis landscape. With your contributions, SOLARIS will become a reality and open the door for more English language Synthesizer V singers.

Vocal synthesizer development is expensive. Up until now, everything for the SOLARIS project has been funded out of pocket by our team members. In order to complete this project, we need to attain funding from outside sources. Given the nature of the vocal synthesis community, we felt that the best way to create SOLARIS would be to harness the passion that fans and vocal synthesis users have shown overwhelmingly in the past. With your support, the SOLARIS project can be realized.

INITIAL GOAL: $40,000

If we reach our initial funding goal of $40,000, we will be able to:

  • Create the SOLARIS AI English library for Synthesizer V Studio in conjunction with Dreamtonics. An AI library will allow for expressive, realistic vocals to be produced that can suit any needs of the user

  • Pay our vocalist, recording artist and former Broadway performer Emma Rowley, for her time and recordings involved in this project.

  • Produce beautiful, detailed key artwork for the SOLARIS project with talented illustrator Superstellar

  • Produce the crowdfund rewards, including paying the guest artists like Edlinklover, MystSaphyr, and staySOCKY who worked with us, paying for manufacturing, packaging, shipping rewards to their final destinations

  • Commission original demonstration songs from skilled vocal synthesis users such as VocaCircus/Circus-P and GHOST who have already signed on to work on demonstration pieces.

STRETCH GOAL: $55,000

Additional funding will go towards:

  • Improving the quality of SOLARIS’ singing capabilities with more AI training data, allowing for alternate pronunciation selections, clearer performance at difficult pitches, and an overall improvement to tone and realism
  • Additional key artworks such as a full reference sheet for the SOLARIS character, and artwork for an alternate design for SOLARIS

 

Incomplete Funding

If we are not fully funded, we will try to come up with the remaining necessary funds on our own to complete the SOLARIS project. This will result in massive delays in reward fulfillment and library completion until these funds are realized, however, we will do our utmost to fulfill them and complete the project. In this scenario, we will update frequently on our status throughout this time and keep you involved via our website and social media accounts. If we are not able to come up with the remaining funds on our own within 6 months of the final day of the crowdfund, pledges will be fully returned to backers.

Eclipsed Sounds, LLC is a small business focused on creating high quality English-language digital vocal instruments. We have been working for over 2 years in collaboration with Dreamtonics to bring the SOLARIS project to fruition, and so far have worked together to create a test version of SOLARIS using the standard Synthesizer V synthesis method. If you have heard of us prior to this project, we formerly produced sanctioned fan merchandise for other vocal synthesis characters, but we moved our full focus toward this project as soon as merchandise sales ended.

 

MEET THE TEAM

Eclipsed Sounds Team

khanadee (Elijah Damon) | CEO

  • Twitter | YouTube

  • khanadee is a producer specializing in vocal synthesis since 2013, khanadee organized “Voxsynth Pride 2020” collaborative album and the “Memories" Dex and Daina 5th anniversary album charity projects. He has also participated in many other collaborative albums within the vocal synthesis community, including two ASDR and Artificial Ensemble albums. 

Niamh Easter | Lead Designer

  • Twitter | Twitch

  • Niamh is a longtime musician and vocal synthesis fan, Niamh has been involved in the community since late 2011. When not working on community related works, Niamh has been drawing and working on concept art for other projects, such as a RWBY webcomic and light novelization since early 2016, and has a background in creating merchandise for local conventions. They have also helped organize several collaborative album projects for different vocal synthesis project anniversaries.

celestrai (Taylor Hennessy) | Marketing and Social Media Manager

  • Twitter | YouTube

  • celestrai is a songwriter and vocal synthesis enthusiast who has been an active member of the vocal synthesis community since early 2011. On her own she has managed multiple large scale community events celebrating the anniversaries of older vocal synthesis characters that include both merchandise distribution and compilation album creation, and participated in others. Outside of vocal synthesis she has completed a degree in computer science.

IrunaBara | Product Manager

  • Twitter | YouTube

  • IrunaBara is primarily known for short comedy skits using vocal synthesis characters, but is also a songwriter who manages several projects to create vocal synthesis characters using free development programs, such as Project Chrysalis. He first joined the vocal synthesis community in late 2014, but has become more active in recent years.

 

SOLARIS Project

Emma Rowley | Voice Provider

  • Website | Twitter | YouTube

  • Emma Rowley is a singer, songwriter and pop recording artist. Pursuing her craft has led her to performing in many exciting places including multiple Broadway stages in NYC (LuPone Gypsy in 2007 and 2008, Bye Bye Birdie in 2009) and twice performing as a featured performer at Carnegie Hall, singing original music at Nashville’s famous Bluebird Cafe, and fronting the jazz band at the historic Grand Hotel on Mackinac Island, MI. 

Superstellar | Key Artist

  • Twitter | Tumblr

  • Superstellar is an illustrator who has been inspired by the world of vocal synths for almost ten years. She uses traditional theory and new technology to create vibrant digital paintings, combining influences from both sci-fi and fantasy.

 

Crowdfund Reward Artists

MystSaphyr / StudioVOXYZ

  • Twitter | YouTube

  • MystSaphyr is an artist and producer who has been active in the vocalsynth community since 2009. She publishes work under the project name Studio VOXYZ, the mascot of which is her self-made UTAU Kikyuune Aiko. As a core member of the doujin circle Myriad she has helped organize a handful of compilation albums, and has participated in ASDR and Artificial Ensemble projects in the past as well.

Edlinklover

  • Twitter | Tumblr | Instagram

  • Edlinklover is a Japanese-American hafu artist, honing their craft since 2011. Their works often feature warm colors in an anime-inspired textured art style. They discovered vocal synths in 2012 and have been passionate about them ever since, making them the prime focus of their work. They have been active in the vocal synth community not only as an artist, but as a writer and hobbyist game developer as well.

staySOCKY

  • Twitter | Tumblr | Instagram

  • A freelance digital artist who loves vibrant colors and fun shapes! Socky has been a long-time fan of vocal synths and enjoys listening to them while they illustrate.

 

(Timeline is tentative. Dates subject to change based on production time.)

 

We have multiple different types of rewards available for supporters of our crowdfund. You can view which rewards are available for each tier in the tier descriptions.

Key Art Rewards

Our campaign’s digital key art rewards are full-resolution digital wallpapers that come in multiple sizes for both desktop and mobile backgrounds. The physical key art rewards include a 5 inch tall acrylic stand, and a 1.5 inch mini button badge. SOLARIS’ key art was created by our main visual artist Superstellar.

 

SOLARIS Team Rewards

The SOLARIS Team rewards were created lovingly by the members of the SOLARIS team. The digital SOLARIS Team reward is the Concept Art PDF, a complete timeline of the making of SOLARIS’ design and key artwork. The physical SOLARIS Team reward is a selection of 5 stickers drawn by the team, including the SOLARIS logo sticker.

 

Guest Artist Rewards

In addition to our key art rewards, we have worked with three talented guest artists to create unique rewards exclusive to our crowdfund. They will not be sold after the crowdfund ends, so this is the only way to get them. These rewards are a 2 inch button badge designed by Edlinklover, a 2.5 inch acrylic charm designed by MystSaphyr, and a 2 inch acrylic charm designed by staySOCKY. The final reveal will be on Friday, May 21 during our Q&A livestream!

 

SOLARIS Synthesizer V Library Rewards

The central rewards for this campaign are those that include the SOLARIS Synthesizer V Library. The digital version of this reward is a download copy of SOLARIS that will be distributed through email. The physical version of this reward will also include a limited edition DVD boxed copy of SOLARIS. We do not intend to sell physical editions of SOLARIS after the crowdfund, so this will be the only way to secure a physical copy. Both digital and traditional backers will receive their digital copies of SOLARIS, including activation codes, one week earlier than her commercial release. Physical editions of SOLARIS will not include activation codes in-box, so physical backers will also receive their activation codes and installers through email at the same time as digital backers.

 

Limited Item Rewards

The limited item rewards are special rewards for our high backer tiers, including physical rewards such as a crowdfund-exclusive tote bag and t-shirt.

 

Add-on Item Rewards

In addition to the primary rewards for each tier, backers can opt-in to 3 add-on items depending on their tier: the SOLARIS production diary, custom SOLARIS voice lines, and an autograph on their physical edition of SOLARIS. The production diary is available for all tiers and is a digital reward that provides an in-depth look at every aspect of SOLARIS, from concept to final production. The custom SOLARIS voice lines are short phrases that you as a backer may request that will be provided as pre-recorded .wav audio samples. These lines must be approved by the Eclipsed Sounds team before they may be given to our vocalist to record. Finally, you can add an autograph from SOLARIS’ vocalist on your physical copy of SOLARIS to any tier that includes a DVD copy.

Share our Campaign

If you can't contribute, or already have and would like to do more to help bring the SOLARIS project to fruition, please share our campaign on social media.

 

Follow Us on Social Media For Updates

Twitter | Facebook | Tumblr | Instagram | YouTube | TikTok

story:
Mictic - Create Music With Your Movement

We’re coming to change your relationship to music. Mictic is the Swiss-made Interactive Audio AR wearable that turns your movements into sound. It doesn’t matter if you already have a Grammy or have never picked up a musical instrument, with Mictic you’ll be expressing yourself the minute you put the wristbands on and connect via Bluetooth.

 

We’re inviting the Indiegogo community to participate in the launch of Mictic through your contributions (and by being among the first to put on the wristbands when we release a limited first run in September). We’ve worked with major label artists and professional dancers in every genre to get here. But now we want to see what you’ll do with it out in the real world -- You the unruly, untamable public. 

 

How: We’ve packed centuries of Swiss engineering into Mictic and brought it into the digital era. And are the first wearable device that is a true musical instrument and not just a controller for Midi or other interfaces. The wristbands use our to translate your arm movements into included instrument sounds like electric guitar, drums, cello, and genre-based soundscapes like EDM and HipHop.

You can even play with our sci-fi and game experiences. More instruments and sounds will be available for upload all the time, including in partnership with artists you love.

Why: We’re coming to you now because we want you to be among the first wave of Mictic users. We want real tech savvy music fans to get the first batch of the wristbands and show us, and the world, what wild and beautiful things they help you create. 

When: Contribute to our Indiegogo campaign and you’ll get the limited first run of Mictic before anyone else. Whether you perform on a stage, in a studio, or simply on TikTok, you’ll be able to incorporate Mictic into what you do before anyone else.

The artist in you will love experimenting with this new musical tool with literally no rules, no one to tell you what you can’t do.

 

How does it work?

The wristbands contain sensors that detect movement and motion with supreme precision and accuracy.   You can connect the sensors with your smartphone via Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE).

 Strap Mictic to your wrists 

 Connect your Smartphone via Bluetooth 

 Pair with the Mictic App

 Pick your Instrument or sound experience 

 Let the Magic happen!

 

 

All sounds from the following demo videos were recorded 100% live!

A short demo video to give you a sneak peek of how our Rock Soundscape works:

 

A raw demo of our Trap Soundscape:

 

Dancer & Choreographer Brian Witsch performs with the Mictic Robot feature:

 

Jonas Vischi, Cellist at the Symphony Orchestra in Luzern (CH), with an amazing solo performance using our wristbands.  

 

 

The Buzz! As seen in: 

 

Mictic on the news:

Last week Mershad Javan, CEO of Mictic,  joined 'Cheddar Innovates' to discuss how this new wearable translates movement into musical tones and sound effects, and how this is going to change the way we interact with music.

Here is a short clip of the product demo - feel free to watch the whole video here!

We got featured on Mashable in their Future Blink section - a sneak peek at the innovations that will change our everyday lives in the future. 

 

Check out Mictic on Reuters TV...

 

and on BBC Turkey.

 

 

The Wristbands:

What you see here is the evolution of our product. We started with experimental tags which we bought from https://mbientlab.com/

Our first few firmwares were designed to run on those tags and we still use them on a daily basis and until our electronic prototypes become available mid April.

In parallel we had an industrial designer design a first version of the wristband and PCB enclosure, our first mechanical design.

Next we had our own PCB design created and with it, we had to adapt the initial mechanical design. We are now at a stage where the PCB and the mechanical design are final, and we move into prototype production.

What you can see in the following picture are various stages of our development. 

The current parts have all been 3d printed.

Here you can see a screenshot from our GERBER files, it shows our final PCB design.

In the following picture you can see screenshots of our final mechanical design, with the PCB sitting in the PCB enclosure.

As soon as we get the electronic prototypes we will place them into 3d printed PCB enclosures. This will help us make sure that the mechanical parts and the PCB fit tightly together. Once done, we will move into production with the mechanical parts, which we expect for mid June. 

 

The App:

Below is a supplementary video that clearly shows our current prototype's functionality and demonstrates the range of features which will be available upon release: 

 

Here is a video showing the experimental version of the App a bit more in detail: 

 

At the moment we are switching to the beta version which you can see in this video:

 

The initial product launch will be available for iOS users only. 

But no worries as the Android version will follow very soon after. 

 

Here is a small preview of the first iteration app design and settings!

 

 

 

Below a list of features which are integrated in the first app version:

 

Instruments:

- Acoustic Guitar

- Electric Guitar

- Cello

- Drums 

- Violin  

 

Soundscapes:

- Hip Hop 

- Trap 

- Latin 

- EDM

- Rock

 

Games:

- Kung Fu

- Robot

- Safari / Zoo

- Lightsaber

- Tennis 

 

We are planing to make many more features available soon after launch!

 

The Packaging:

At the moment we are going back and forth between 2 different design concepts and would like to involve the Kickstarter community in our final decision. 

Concept 1

 

Concept 2

Below a few images showing the production process of the electronic prototypes in Switzerland:

 

For whom is it?

EVERYONE! Our mission is to give everyone the power to express themselves no matter what kind of music they enjoy, and whether they are already Grammy-winners, or have had no training at all. Mictic can be used for any age range and you really don't have to be a musician to enjoy it. 

 'If' You're a Professional Musician:

You can connect and use Mictic via Bluetooth as Midi controller for your favorite digital audio workstation (DAW) such as Ableton, Logic, Pro Tools, Garageband or 100s of other MIDI-compatible apps. Here is a little guide for Ableton Max 4 Live on OSX.

 

 

 

About Us

Mictic AG is a fast-growing startup dedicated to developing innovative user experience in augmented reality. The Zurich-based company applies technology to profoundly change the way people interact with music and their own movements. Its mission is to make musical expression more accessible to the masses, whether they’re already Grammy-winners or have no training at all.

 

Risks and challenges

Have you recently ordered a PlayStation 5 and are still waiting for it to ship? Like many businesses we are also affected by a global disruption of semiconductor products. Components can become sparse and delay production, and like many, that is a risk that we are exposed to.  We will immediately provide full transparency on such issues.

So far we have only tested on newer Apple devices.  Like with many apps, old iPhones may lead to a reduced user experience due to system load and available resources. Our team is working very hard to provide the best experience on all devices.

There are tens of thousands of different Android out there on the market and while we will make sure to test and guarantee the best user experience on the most popular models, we unfortunately cannot do that for all Android devices.

Bluetooth speaker options and quality may also vary. Some of the more cost effective versions may reduce sound quality when used via Bluetooth.

Mictic strives to minimise our impact on the planet. Therefore, we have opted to provide a simple ‘charging only’ USB cable.
story_txt:
Mictic - Create Music With Your MovementWe’re coming to change your relationship to music. Mictic is the Swiss-made Interactive Audio AR wearable that turns your movements into sound. It doesn’t matter if you already have a Grammy or have never picked up a musical instrument, with Mictic you’ll be expressing yourself the minute you put the wristbands on and connect via Bluetooth. We’re inviting the Indiegogo community to participate in the launch of Mictic through your contributions (and by being among the first to put on the wristbands when we release a limited first run in September). We’ve worked with major label artists and professional dancers in every genre to get here. But now we want to see what you’ll do with it out in the real world -- You the unruly, untamable public.  How: We’ve packed centuries of Swiss engineering into Mictic and brought it into the digital era. And are the first wearable device that is a true musical instrument and not just a controller for Midi or other interfaces. The wristbands use our to translate your arm movements into included instrument sounds like electric guitar, drums, cello, and genre-based soundscapes like EDM and HipHop.You can even play with our sci-fi and game experiences. More instruments and sounds will be available for upload all the time, including in partnership with artists you love.Why: We’re coming to you now because we want you to be among the first wave of Mictic users. We want real tech savvy music fans to get the first batch of the wristbands and show us, and the world, what wild and beautiful things they help you create. 
When: Contribute to our Indiegogo campaign and you’ll get the limited first run of Mictic before anyone else. Whether you perform on a stage, in a studio, or simply on TikTok, you’ll be able to incorporate Mictic into what you do before anyone else.The artist in you will love experimenting with this new musical tool with literally no rules, no one to tell you what you can’t do. How does it work?The wristbands contain sensors that detect movement and motion with supreme precision and accuracy.   You can connect the sensors with your smartphone via Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE). Strap Mictic to your wrists  Connect your Smartphone via Bluetooth  Pair with the Mictic App Pick your Instrument or sound experience  Let the Magic happen!  All sounds from the following demo videos were recorded 100% live!A short demo video to give you a sneak peek of how our Rock Soundscape works:

 
A raw demo of our Trap Soundscape:


 
Dancer & Choreographer Brian Witsch performs with the Mictic Robot feature:


 
Jonas Vischi, Cellist at the Symphony Orchestra in Luzern (CH), with an amazing solo performance using our wristbands.  



 

 
The Buzz! As seen in: 

 
Mictic on the news:
Last week Mershad Javan, CEO of Mictic,  joined 'Cheddar Innovates' to discuss how this new wearable translates movement into musical tones and sound effects, and how this is going to change the way we interact with music.
Here is a short clip of the product demo - feel free to watch the whole video here!

We got featured on Mashable in their Future Blink section - a sneak peek at the innovations that will change our everyday lives in the future. 

 
Check out Mictic on Reuters TV...


 
and on BBC Turkey.

 

 
The Wristbands:
What you see here is the evolution of our product. We started with experimental tags which we bought from https://mbientlab.com/Our first few firmwares were designed to run on those tags and we still use them on a daily basis and until our electronic prototypes become available mid April.In parallel we had an industrial designer design a first version of the wristband and PCB enclosure, our first mechanical design.Next we had our own PCB design created and with it, we had to adapt the initial mechanical design. We are now at a stage where the PCB and the mechanical design are final, and we move into prototype production.What you can see in the following picture are various stages of our development. The current parts have all been 3d printed.Here you can see a screenshot from our GERBER files, it shows our final PCB design.In the following picture you can see screenshots of our final mechanical design, with the PCB sitting in the PCB enclosure.As soon as we get the electronic prototypes we will place them into 3d printed PCB enclosures. This will help us make sure that the mechanical parts and the PCB fit tightly together. Once done, we will move into production with the mechanical parts, which we expect for mid June.  The App:Below is a supplementary video that clearly shows our current prototype's functionality and demonstrates the range of features which will be available upon release: 

 
Here is a video showing the experimental version of the App a bit more in detail: 
 At the moment we are switching to the beta version which you can see in this video: The initial product launch will be available for iOS users only. But no worries as the Android version will follow very soon after.  Here is a small preview of the first iteration app design and settings!   Below a list of features which are integrated in the first app version: Instruments:- Acoustic Guitar- Electric Guitar- Cello- Drums - Violin   Soundscapes:- Hip Hop - Trap - Latin - EDM- Rock
 

Games:
- Kung Fu
- Robot
- Safari / Zoo
- Lightsaber
- Tennis 
 
We are planing to make many more features available soon after launch!
 
The Packaging: 
At the moment we are going back and forth between 2 different design concepts and would like to involve the Kickstarter community in our final decision. 
Concept 1

 
Concept 2

Below a few images showing the production process of the electronic prototypes in Switzerland:


 
For whom is it?EVERYONE! Our mission is to give everyone the power to express themselves no matter what kind of music they enjoy, and whether they are already Grammy-winners, or have had no training at all. Mictic can be used for any age range and you really don't have to be a musician to enjoy it.  'If' You're a Professional Musician:You can connect and use Mictic via Bluetooth as Midi controller for your favorite digital audio workstation (DAW) such as Ableton, Logic, Pro Tools, Garageband or 100s of other MIDI-compatible apps. Here is a little guide for Ableton Max 4 Live on OSX.   About UsMictic AG is a fast-growing startup dedicated to developing innovative user experience in augmented reality. The Zurich-based company applies technology to profoundly change the way people interact with music and their own movements. Its mission is to make musical expression more accessible to the masses, whether they’re already Grammy-winners or have no training at all. Risks and challengesHave you recently ordered a PlayStation 5 and are still waiting for it to ship? Like many businesses we are also affected by a global disruption of semiconductor products. Components can become sparse and delay production, and like many, that is a risk that we are exposed to.  We will immediately provide full transparency on such issues.So far we have only tested on newer Apple devices.  Like with many apps, old iPhones may lead to a reduced user experience due to system load and available resources. Our team is working very hard to provide the best experience on all devices.There are tens of thousands of different Android out there on the market and while we will make sure to test and guarantee the best user experience on the most popular models, we unfortunately cannot do that for all Android devices.Bluetooth speaker options and quality may also vary. Some of the more cost effective versions may reduce sound quality when used via Bluetooth.Mictic strives to minimise our impact on the planet. Therefore, we have opted to provide a simple ‘charging only’ USB cable.

story:
At Phazon, we believe people deserve truly wireless headphones that are both comfortable & stable, have great sound quality and look good.

In designing our earbuds, we have been inspired by those two pain points:
1. Inconvenience from the headphone wires, especially during sports activities.
2. While working relentlessly on the project we came up with something truly innovative:

Phazon is making the world’s first one-size-fits-all wireless earbuds - guaranteed not to fall off.

Wireless earbuds have been around recently. However, they offer very poor comfort and stability. While they claim that inserts (plastic or foam) can fix the problems, we know it won’t. Have you already tried earbuds with inserts? It just doesn’t work well in an active environment. We plan to change all that with our product and patent pending form factor. That’s right, with a simple twist motion, everyone gets a snug fit with only 1 size and 0 inserts.

How is our one-size-fits-all earbuds different from any other product? Knowing that there is an inner ear pattern that everyone shares, we made many iterations to find our fit. With our twist motion, the fit is so solid that you can literally dive into the water and it will stay in place. It's a completely snug fit. Any sports from casual jogging to skydiving will let you listen to music flawlessly.

In the wireless earbud industry, it’s critical to have that great snug fit. After all, you surely don’t want to lose your earbuds while playing sports!

 

 

 
COLOR SELECTION: You'll be prompt to choose your color shortly after purchase


THIS IS WHAT YOU'LL GET IF YOU PLEDGE NOW

You'll also be able to download our free mobile app!

 

We've reached 4 stretch goals so a big THANK YOU ;)

1st Strech goal: Midnight blue color

 

2nd Strech goal: Equalizer app

 

But wait, what is an EQUALIZER?

In simple terms: it enhances the sound, based on your favorite music style. So let's say you like rap music, the equalizer will boost the bass. If you like classic music, it will boost the treble.


3rd Strech goal: Battery indicator + T-Shirts giveaway

Beside than having a simple native battery display on your phone, we'll also implement a more accurate battery level indicator in our app. 

Because many people wear t-shirts when they workout, well, why not a free Phazon t-shirt (Superpowers included)!
 

4th Strech goal: Sunset color

The Sunset color is finally available!

 

The earbuds require a simple connection with any Bluetooth device, such as a smartphone

.... and a smartwatch!

 

 

 

Sound quality is a BIG priority for us – obviously! That’s why from the beginning we consulted with a world renowned sound specialist. With his advice, we not only choose the best electronic components when designing the product, but also the optimal way to have great sound.

With our dynamic driver, you can expect excellent all around sound from bass to treble, as opposed to balanced armature driver. You can experience the best bass sound quality on the truly wireless earbuds market .

In addition, we are actually using the same speaker as major high end audio companies.

 

After consulting with top audiologists and doing multiple iterations, we found out something interesting. Combining our special form factor with a simple twist motion, everyone is having a comfortable and stable earbuds experience.

Yes. It fits everyone - guaranteed - from teenagers to seniors. We agree that every ear is unique and we have found a unique way to fit them all. The inner part of the ear is basically the same for everyone, with our form factor and a simple twist motion, everyone will get a comfy and stable fit. After testing our earbuds with over 500 people, they all agreed that the fit was comfortable and stable (100%). That's why we are pretty confident in our statement.

Here's is our special form factor (feel free to play around with):

Still not sure of our fit? We took our earbuds for the ultimate test, check the video right below!

 

 

Our charging case can hold at least 1 extra charge for the earbuds. There is also a convenient keychain hole on top so you can easily carry it with you. You'll be able to charge the case with a micro USB.

 
Check out below our quick demo of the charging case prototype!
 

 

Don't panic! We have an app for this!

Available for iOS and Android devices!

 

 

The one size fits all: A patent pending twist motion that allow the earbud to sit tightly but comfortably in your ear. Just pair it to your phone and Voilà! No apps, no wires, one button only! You use only one or both earbuds and the process is the same, with a simple push of a button you are ready to sync the earbuds to any phone with Bluetooth.

 

BATTERY

Battery: 50mAh

Standby: 300h (expected)

Complete recharge: 30 minutes (expected)

 

SPEAKER

Response bandwidth: 20-20000 Hz

Impedance: 16 Ohm

Output: 10 mW RMS

Audio format: 16 bit stereo

 

BLUETOOTH

Compatible with any Bluetooth device. Optimal functionalities with Bluetooth 4.0 and higher (release after 2011).
 

Initial 2D sketches

 

First batch of prototypes

 

Advanced prototypes

 

Designing and testing the PCB (printed circuit board)

 

Calibrating and testing our electronics components

 

 

Chris Houle is the Founder and CEO of Phazon. With a background in accounting/taxation and extensive work experience, he provides an invaluable insight into Phazon’s financial position, strategic capital allocation and business acumen. He also played sports on a professional level, developing a vast network of athletes that are helping in this project. Frédéric Besner is the Co-Founder and CTO of Phazon. With a background in electrical engineering he understands the electronics like no other. His knowledge of both the software and hardware part of the project makes him the perfect CTO. Sylvain Savard recently joined our team as a software engineer. He is an expert in embedded systems and has a vast experience in wireless and audio equipments. His deep knowledge will certainly fast forward the development of the product.

Finally, the design experts, Maxime Vignola and Guillaume Renaud. Together they founded EDGE Dimension, a 3D animation studio, where they developed an unmatched expertise in photorealistic 3D rendering and interactive projects for clients all over the world.

Phazon also has two prestigious advisors on board. The first one is the president of a multinational company specialized in audio protection buds. They have over 50 patents worldwide and provided audio support for big companies such as Apple. The other advisor is a top notch doctorate teacher and a renowned sound specialist. Up to this day, he has 4 ear related patents. He's also the editor-in-chief of the Canadian acoustic association.

 

The exciting and innovative concept of the Phazon wireless earbuds surfaced in March 2014. Chris had become frustrated with his gym experience due to the constant encumbrance of his earbuds. The earbud wires would always get tangled, fall out of his ears or detach from his music player. The constant interruption proved to be of significant annoyance, so he sought a solution to his problem.

Looking for an immediate solution he went on to look for an earbud that had Bluetooth connectivity, a good fit and sleek design. Upon doing online research he found that none of his three basic needs would be met by any current product.

At this point, new team members joined in, as they began researching and developing this new technology; an innovative take on the Bluetooth system was developed. Meanwhile, Chris started looking to build the world’s most comfortable and stable earbud by doing lots of iterations with the help of an industrial designer. The entire concept is something truly innovative to the everyday consumer. The product concept was inspired by the gap in the current global marketplace.

Phazon has a very simple objective: provide customers with a quality listening experience that is free of constraints. This high quality experience is one of the driving forces of Phazon. The earbud itself is a compact piece of technology, which boasts a sleek design. Available in 5 different colors the earbud has a snug fit and is smaller than a quarter. Using innovative methods the company has been able to shape the earbud so that it would comfortably fit without causing pressure to the user or fall out. Phazon currently has a utility patent pending on both the fit and design aspects. As a wireless device, it connects via Bluetooth to any nearby music player with supporting software, such as standard smartphones.

 

Shipping costs will be automatically calculated once you select a reward.

Depending on the number of earbuds you select + where you live on the planet, the shipping cost will vary. If you come pick it up at our Montreal office, we'll reimburse you the shipping.

Shipping worldwide!

Please note that shipping to any country outside North America and Canada may be delayed or cancelled depending on the feasibility of local product approval requirements or local import regulations. In a case of cancellation we will refund your pledge. There may be additional duties, fees or taxes raised by the authorities in your country. You may need to take care of them yourself when receiving the shipment.

We are really excited to launch the first ever one-size-fits-all wireless earbuds. It’s far more than a simple concept, it’s already a functional prototype.

We do know however, that there will challenges down the road and we’re confident we’ll overcome them because of the support from our accelerator “Launchhouse” based in Cleveland and the extraordinary team we have gathered.

We have preliminary agreements with manufacturers. We’ll face challenges with production, packaging and shipping worldwide but we have top notch advisors onboard. With their extensive background and work experience, the road will be much more easy.

We’ll work hard and relentlessly to deliver you an incredible product, which has been our commitment since the beginning of this project!

Can’t wait for you guys to get our revolutionary earbuds!

Thank you,

The Phazon Team

--------------------------
Media kit available here: https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0Bwzx6nWQZznVSHh2YU5RVDlYUDA&usp=sharing
 
 

 
Q. How do I choose my color?
A. The color selection will happen shortly after purchase.

Q. Is there a microphone included?
A. Yes! You'll be able to take and make calls. No hands :)

Q. Is there a risk if I'm contributing?
A. We feel fully accountable to the backers. You can be sure that we'll keep a rigorous eye on the financials. We have a highly talented team and we are 100% dedicated to ship an outstanding product, no matter what.

Q. Is there a warranty?
A. We are super serious in getting the best user experience possible. We offer a 1-year warranty on all the electronic components.

Q. I have small / abnormal ears, will the earbuds fit?
A. We tested over 500 people and they all agreed the fit was comfortable and stable. Please check out our testimonials video here: Testimonials

Q. How is the sound quality?
A. Sound quality is a top priority for us. That's why we partnered with a world renowned sound specialist, Mr. Voix. He's a professor at an engineering school, owns ear related patents and is the editor in chief of the Canadian Acoustic Association. We're also using the same speakers as high-end audio companies.

Q. Are the earbuds waterproof?
A. Yes! You can go up to 1 meter (3 feet) of water depth with the earbuds. However, please note the Bluetooth connectivity will drop below 5 centimeters (2 inches).

Q. What happens if I change my address before you ship?
A. We'll make an announcement 1 month before we ship. You'll then be able to update your address on your Indiegogo profile

story:
Missed out on the Indiegogo campaign and still want to pre-order the MI Guitar and save $100 off retail before we ship? Head over to our new website and learn more.

 

By pressing the correct button for the chords, then strumming or plucking the strings, the lyrics advance automatically, in time with your playing.

You can purchase the lyrics and chord numbers for an individual song for 99 cents, or if you prefer, access all songs in the entire song catalog for a subscription fee of $5.99/month (all prices subject to change). We offer a 30-day free trial so you can try the service for free.

Instantly play your favorite songs using our companion mobile app, available on iOS and Android on both phones and tablets. Our app contains a large catalog of thousands of popular songs - just select the song you want to play and you can see the song's lyrics and button numbers for each chord. By pressing the right buttons and strumming the strings, you can play the song. 

The MI Guitar is more than an easy and fun way to play your favorite songs instantly. It's also a tool to create your own original music - even if you have little or no musical background.

Set the guitar to any key and scale you want to play in (for example, E Major, or B-flat Minor, or A Blues), and we give you one-finger access to the most commonly played chords in that key and scale. The chord types you can play include:

  • major
  • minor
  • power
  • suspended
  • major seventh
  • minor seventh
  • dominant seventh

It’s like having an entire chord encyclopedia at the touch of your fingers.

It’s easy and intuitive to improvise, jam, or compose good-sounding original music, because we use principles of music theory to organize the fretboard and give you choices that sound good.

If you are a songwriter, you can use the MI Guitar as a MIDI controller, and integrate it with your existing songwriting software, or your DAW (Digital Audio Workstation), such as Apple GarageBand, Apple Logic Pro, or Ableton Live.

The MI Guitar comes with six included guitar sounds, as well as two bass guitar sounds. You can purchase and download additional instrument sounds through our mobile app.

Shape your sound with the built-in audio controls such as volume, bass/treble tonal balance, reverb and chorus effects.

The MI Guitar comes with a standard ¼” guitar output jack, so you can plug into any guitar pedal, amp, or mixer for additional effects, amplification, or recording.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Q: What about left handed people, can we play it too?

A: Yes! Please select the $49 "Left Handed Rockers Unite!" Perk to reserve your left handed MI Guitar and share with other lefties that want to rock. We need 1,000 reservations to justify the engineering and tooling costs. If we receive 1,000 reservations, we will ask you to finalize your order through our perk management portal. Magic Instruments will create an order and you will receive a Purchase Agreement indicating the purchase price of the device ($299 USD), plus estimates of any applicable taxes, duties, transport and delivery charges, and any other applicable fees. If you proceed with the order, we will apply your Reservation Payment towards the order payment. Until you enter into a Purchase Agreement, your Reservation may be cancelled at any time, in which case you will receive a full refund of your Reservation Payment. If we do not collect 1,000 reservations before the end of the campaign, we will not manufacture a left handed model of the MI Guitar and refund your reservation via PayPal. This is only a reservation and you understand that we will not hold your Reservation Payment separately or in an escrow or trust fund or pay any interest on your Reservation Payment. 

Q: What if I'm a lefty, but already pre-ordered a right handed MI Guitar?

A: The very least, you'll still get your right handed guitar. But if we can get 1,000 or more left handed rockers interested, we will ask for your preference through our perk management portal before we start manufacturing.

Q: How do I select the color of my guitar? Are there any other colors other than black or white?

A: We will ask for your color selection after the completion of the campaign through the perk management portal. At this time, we are only offering black and white, but may offer more colors if there is a large demand of 5,000 units or more.

Q: Why, where, and how will you be collecting sales tax?

A: Magic Instruments is required by law to collect state sales tax for orders shipped to California, Illinois and Pennsylvania, as our company and our fulfillment partner have a physical presence in these states. For backers with shipping addresses in those states, our perk management portal will calculate sales tax and allow you to pay with any major credit card after the campaign has finished and before we ship perks to backers. Note that if we open up additional fulfillment locations in additional states, we will be required by law to charge sales tax for residents of those states.

Q: How are you handling international orders? (Continued)

While this Reservation secures the approximate delivery priority within your region, it does not constitute the purchase or order of Magic Instruments’ products. When the start of production for your Reservation nears, we will ask you to finalize your order. Magic Instruments will create an order and you will receive a Purchase Agreement indicating the purchase price of the device, plus estimates of any applicable taxes, duties, transport and delivery charges, and any other applicable fees. If you proceed with the order, we will apply your Reservation Payment towards the order payment. Until you enter into a Purchase Agreement, your Reservation may be cancelled at any time, in which case you will receive a full refund of your Reservation Payment. This refund policy is only valid for international backers.

Q: How much does the MI Guitar weigh?

A: Approximately five pounds.

 

SOME INTERESTING FACTS

12% of the US population play a musical instrument
Source: National Endowment for the Arts, 2012 Survey of Public Participation

82% of Americans wish they had learned to play a musical instrument
Source: NAMM 2009 Gallup Poll

Of the people who play musical instruments, 91% started learning before the age of 14.
Source: NAMM 2011 Gallup Poll

90% of people learning guitar quit in the first year.
Source: Fender
story_txt:
Missed out on the Indiegogo campaign and still want to pre-order the MI Guitar and save $100 off retail before we ship? Head over to our new website and learn more. By pressing the correct button for the chords, then strumming or plucking the strings, the lyrics advance automatically, in time with your playing.You can purchase the lyrics and chord numbers for an individual song for 99 cents, or if you prefer, access all songs in the entire song catalog for a subscription fee of $5.99/month (all prices subject to change). We offer a 30-day free trial so you can try the service for free.Instantly play your favorite songs using our companion mobile app, available on iOS and Android on both phones and tablets. Our app contains a large catalog of thousands of popular songs - just select the song you want to play and you can see the song's lyrics and button numbers for each chord. By pressing the right buttons and strumming the strings, you can play the song. The MI Guitar is more than an easy and fun way to play your favorite songs instantly. It's also a tool to create your own original music - even if you have little or no musical background.

Set the guitar to any key and scale you want to play in (for example, E Major, or B-flat Minor, or A Blues), and we give you one-finger access to the most commonly played chords in that key and scale. The chord types you can play include:


major
minor
power
suspended
major seventh
minor seventh
dominant seventh

It’s like having an entire chord encyclopedia at the touch of your fingers.

story:
ENJOY GOING TO BED!

 

Play high-quality audio of your choosing, in your bed.  It's private audio without headphones.

The Aurras is a specially-designed audio device for you to enjoy in bed— say goodbye to cumbersome headphones and disturbing others with your relaxation necessities. With a powerful Bluetooth amplifier and equalizer, the Aurras can easily be placed under your pillow to play your preferred content with high-quality audio.

 Your pillow just became your speaker, and your best friend.

 

 

FREEDOM TO LISTEN IN COMFORT

 

It’s easy to love the Aurras: 

 
  • High-quality audio components makes listening easy, and enjoyable
  • Fits under every pillow
  • Doesn't bother your sleeping partner

 

 

  • No more sore ears from headphones
  • Small and lightweight design for traveling needs

 

 

 

READ ABOUT US

The Dreampad pillows, which use the same type of technology as the Aurras, have received rave reviews from the press.   

 

WHAT DO YOU WANT TO HEAR?

Aurras was designed so you can listen to anything, with the best listening experience possible. The Aurras device utilizes a built-in equalizer to optimize whatever you're listening to. Whether your bedtime or naptime routine involves music, podcasts, or audiobooks — you’ll be listening with quality and comfortability.

 

 

 

QUALITY SOUND MADE FOR YOU

How can you possibly have good audio going through a pillow?  First, we've designed the Aurras to use bone conduction technology, which creates a unique resonance that permeates the entire pillow.

 

 

Second, we pair the Aurras with a 1-Watt Bluetooth amplifier with a built-in equalizer to optimize the sound for what you’re listening to.  The Bluetooth amplifier includes a bass booster to provide enhanced low-end vibrations, which has been found to help support relaxation and sleep.

 

If your sleeping partner is the type who needs a quiet room, and your oscillating fan or audiobook is bothersome, the Aurras is the perfect solution to a comfortable sleep environment for both parties. No more bothering someone else with your audio, or waking up in the middle of the night to a missing or low battery earbud, or needing to untangle your headphone cords just to sleep in your go-to position. 

 

 

 

HOW DOES IT WORK?

The Aurras is a thin, discrete, personalized speaker for under your pillow that only you can hear.  It is designed to provide enough output to get through your pillow, but without broadcasting the sound throughout your bedroom.  

It's like magic, but it's science.  

 

It's simple to use: 

  • Plug the aux cable into the included Bluetooth amp
  • Power on and pair to your phone
  • Choose an EQ setting - podcasts, audiobooks, or music
  • Slip the Aurras under your pillow
  • Select your content on your phone - podcast, audiobook, music, nature sounds, shows
  • Adjust the volume as needed

It's as simple as that.  The Bluetooth amp has a battery and will need charging, available with the included USB charging cable.  

 

PERKS

 

  • AURRAS EARLY-BIRD  - GET THE AURRAS FOR $49 - A 50% DISCOUNT FROM RETAIL.  SHIPS IN DECEMBER 2020

 

  • AURRAS INDIEGOGO SPECIAL - GET THE AURRAS FOR $59 - A 40% DISCOUNT FROM RETAIL.  SHIPS IN JANUARY 2021

 

  • AURRAS EARLY BIRD X2 - GET 2 FOR $89 - A 55% DISCOUNT FROM RETAIL.  SHIPS IN DECEMBER 2020

 

  • AURRAS INDIEGOGO SPECIAL X2 - GET 2 AURRAS FOR $109 - A 45% DISCOUNT FROM RETAIL.  SHIPS IN JANUARY 2021

 

 

WHEN TO EXPECT YOUR AURRAS

We are working diligently to complete the first mass production batch of the Aurras. With your help, we can meet our goal of shipping the Aurras to Early Bird backers in December.  We cannot guarantee delivery before Christmas due to many bottlenecks that still exist in the transportation world - however, we will do our best, and will keep you informed.  We expect to receive the second batch of product in January, and will ship product out by the end of January.

 

 

 

RELAX EASIER AND SLEEP BETTER

The Aurras and Dreampad products were designed and built with the goal of helping our customers get into a healthier sleep pattern with the most natural medicine available— sound and music. Over the years, Dreampad pillows have helped tens of thousands of people with serious sleep problems with the simple yet unique implementation of bone conduction technology.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Our biggest challenge is making sure we can finalize our first mass production batch in order to get the product to our backers before the end of the year.  This requires a big push in November, and early December.  We will be expediting the shipment for a limited quantity of Aurras to make sure they’re delivered as soon as possible. 

Our team of audio designers has finalized the prototypes and all approvals are complete.  In order to save time and improve product quality assurance, we have procured a custom-designed test fixture to rapidly test each module.

 

Our logistics team has also put in place a plan to ship and process all orders as soon as the product arrives at our Denver facility.

 

PRODUCTION GOALS

We are working hard to raise a minimum of $20,000 to get us through the final stages of certification, production, quality control, packaging and shipping.  We plan to complete a specified quantity, ship by air, and then put on doorsteps, into hands, and under pillows.  Here's what we've been doing, and what we have to do, to meet these goals:

 

 

DREAMPAD:  PIONEERS IN MUSIC FOR SLEEP

The creators of Dreampad have been delivering high-quality music pillows for sleep and relaxation since 2014.  The Dreampad pillow was developed based on the idea of “bone conduction,” a discovery made by the notorious deaf composer Ludwig van Beethoven in the 18th century. In bone conduction listening, certain devices can vibrate and produce sound waves, ultimately producing a calming response in the body. Based on this therapeutic insight, the vibrational music technology was embedded into these pillows to create a relaxing and restful bedtime sound experience.

However, we all have that perfect pillow— the pillow that somehow manages to survive the updates in our bedding— the pillow with our personal indent in it.  The Aurras was born as the next step in the sleep sound evolution, creating beautiful, and isolated audio.

 

OUR TEAM

The Dreampad team has decades of combined experience developing and manufacturing quality sleep and audio products.  We have combined our expertise in sleep and relaxation science with advanced audio design to bring the Aurras from conception to mass production.

 

Rick Renner, CEO.  Rick led the design effort for the Aurras, and as CEO, manages the marketing, sales and operations of the company.  Rick has played a number of business roles over the years, including founding and taking public a renewable energy company prior to Dreampad.

Kate O’Brien-Minson, Founder and Advisor.  One of the founders of Dreampad, Kate has years of experience in therapeutic listening product development and sales, as well as managing Dreampad’s former parent company.

Ron Minson, M.D., Advisor.  Ron has been a pioneer in the therapeutic application of sound, and has been instrumental in helping the company build its reputation as a leading relaxation and sleep product company.

Colin Ward, CEO of 1dBfs Technologies and Audio Engineer.  Colin has been leading product design and manufacturing for the Aurras.  Colin has several decades in audio design and high-tech design and manufacturing.

Mike Klasco, CEO of Menlo Scientific.  Mike has been an advisor and trusted partner from the beginning of the Aurras development.  Mike has a long history of audio product design and development, including the Beats by Dre headphones.

David Lindberg, CEO of dB Enterprises.  Dave has a long history of project management, sales and manufacturing of high-tech and audio products, and has assisted Dreampad in getting the Aurras up to mass production scale.

Alex Rhodes, Marketing.  Alex has been with us since the beginning, helping to launch the original Dreampad product line and has put together several crowdfunding campaigns.

Mathew Gawiak, Graphic Design and Customer Support.  Mathew keeps our customers happy and manages our website and graphics work.

 

THANK YOU!

Thanks for taking the time to check out the latest from Dreampad.  We hope you will try the Aurras and let us know what you think!
